Literature Review: The concept of R&D lag has been a topic of interest in the field of economics for several decades. The idea that research investments take many years to affect productivity is well-established, but the exact nature of this lag is often misunderstood. This literature review aims to revisit the conceptual foundations of R&D lag models, review prevalent practice, and document and discuss a range of evidence on R&D lags in agriculture and other industries.
